title: Bug 3666 - Code Completion Hungry code assist
OB:
Under certain circumstances, the code assist feature is replacing the entire method call `baz(x.foo())` with `baz(x.foo().foo())` which is not the expected behavior. The actual behavior should be that only the first `foo()` call should be replaced.

Example:
Before modification:
baz(x.foo())

After modification:
baz(x.foo().foo())
EB:
The code assist feature should correctly replace only until the cursor location when modifying method calls. In the given example, the line of code `baz(x.foo())` should be modified to `baz(x.foo()x.foo())`.

Example:
Before modification:
baz(x.foo())

After modification:
baz(x.foo().foo())

Note: The choice between replacing until the end or until the cursor location should be conditioned by a keystroke, such as enter for replace until end and insert for replace until cursor location.
